intro: Atriplex halimus var. ramosissima, commonly known as the desert saltbush, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Mediterranean and parts of the Middle East. It is characterized by its glabrous, succulent leaves that are often covered in a salt-tolerant coating, allowing it to thrive in saline soils. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, which are typically followed by small, bead-like fruits. It has a deep root system that enables it to access water from deeper soil layers, making it drought-resistant. This variety is also notable for its ability to stabilize soils and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
